CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: "Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and he comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of he city, a veritable goodwill ambassador...2. He sends the Y.M.C.A. Emblem club and guests into gales of laughter with his funny stories.  In picture 2) He sends the Y.M.C.A. Emblem club and guests into gales of laughter with his funny stories"
TitMainTitle: Bill "Bojangles" Robinson standing at banquet table for YMCA emblem club dinner, with other men and women seated beside him, possibly including his wife Fannie Clay Robinson second from right
